column5: I was thinking my next purchase to be the Diawa Theory 2500 spinning reel.  I am confident that this will be a solid reel, but would like some of your opinions on it, good or bad.

I have no idea about that model of Diawa but I will share my experience with them.  I bought a capricorn and it didn't last a month.  Keep in mind I guide in the summer and use my gear every day and use it hard.  I'll never buy another spinning reel that's not a shimano.  I beat the heck out of my stradics and they are solid reels.  Just my opinion though....
All my spinning reels are Daiwas.  I particularly like my Theory.
Team Daiwa advantage reels aren't too shabby.
Never had a problem with mine and I know others that have a whole fleet of them and have had them for years with no issues.  All good and wouldn't hesitate to buy more.
